com.ethercis.servicemanager.common.xml

Class ConfigSetter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ethercis.servicemanager.common.xml.ConfigHandler
      • com.ethercis.servicemanager.common.xml.ConfigSetter

  • public class ConfigSetter
extends ConfigHandler
    perform write operations on config XML

    This class implements methods required to create, insert, delete and set (update) elements and attributes.

      • setElement

        public org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject[] setElement(java.lang.String pathexp,
                                                  java.lang.Object value,
                                                  boolean withIntegrity)
        Set an element located at a path with an value

        The path can return a list of elements to set, in this case all matching elements are set.

        Parameters:
        pathexp - the XPath expression to get the element
        value - an Object compatible with the value to set
        withIntegrity - - true if referential integrity is to be checked
        Returns:
        true if success, false if refential integrity is compromised, or path return null

      • setElement

        public org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject[] setElement(java.lang.String pathexp,
                                                  java.lang.Object val)
        set an element with integrity checking

        Parameters:
        pathexp - the XPath expression to get the element
        value - an Object compatible with the value to set
        Returns:
        true if success, false if refential integrity is compromised, or path return null

        set the value of the last element matching an XPath query

      • insertElement

        public org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject[] insertElement(java.lang.String pathexp,
                                                     java.lang.String xmlval)
        insert a new element located at a given path

        The path can return a list of elements to set, in this case all matching elements get a new element to be inserted.
        The method uses either an addNewXYZ scheme or try to set a simple value if this fails

        Parameters:
        pathexp - - the select filter
        xmlval - - the value to insert
        Returns:
        an array of object with inserted values or null if error

      • deleteElement

        public org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject[] deleteElement(java.lang.String pathexp)
        Delete an element at a given path

        The path can return a list of elements to set, in this case all matching elements are removed.

        Parameters:
        pathexp -
        Returns:
